questions.question: What is your name?
questions.answer: I am a chatbot created to assist you. How can I help today?

questions.question: How are you?
questions.answer: I'm a bot, so I don't have feelings, but thanks for asking! How can I assist you?

questions.question: What can you do?
questions.answer: I can provide information and answer questions based on my knowledge base. How may I assist you?

questions.question: Tell me a joke.
questions.answer: Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything!

questions.question: Can you tell me a fun fact?
questions.answer: Sure! Did you know that honey never spoils? Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs.                     that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible!

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.answer: The capital of France is Paris.

questions.question: Who is the president of the United States?
questions.answer: As of my last update, the President of the United States is Joe Biden.

questions.question: What is the tallest mountain in the world?
questions.answer: Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world, standing at approximately 29,032 feet (8,849 meters) above                       sea level.

questions.question: What's the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.answer: The largest ocean on Earth is the Pacific Ocean, covering approximately 63 million square miles (165 million square kilometers).

questions.question: How many planets are in our solar system?
questions.answer: There are eight planets in our solar system: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.

questions.question: Do you have any hobbies?
questions.answer: As a chatbot, I don't have hobbies in the traditional sense, but I enjoy providing assistance and learning new things!

questions.question: What is your favorite color?
questions.answer: As a chatbot, I don't have preferences, but I can help you find information about colors or anything else you need!

questions.question: How do you spell 'supercalifragilisticexpialidocious'?
questions.answer: S-U-P-E-R-C-A-L-I-F-R-A-G-I-L-I-S-T-I-C-E-X-P-I-A-L-I-D-O-C-I-O-U-S. It's a long word, isn't it?

questions.question: Can you tell me about the history of pizza?
questions.answer: Pizza, as we know it today, originated in Naples, Italy, in the 18th century. It was initially a food for the poor, but it gained popularity and spread around the world, becoming one of the most beloved dishes globally.

questions.question: What is the meaning of life?
questions.answer: That's a philosophical question with many interpretations. Some say it's about finding happiness, others believe it's about fulfilling a purpose or serving others. What do you think?

questions.question: What's the difference between a crocodile and an alligator?
questions.answer: Crocodiles and alligators are both large, aquatic reptiles, but they have some differences. One notable difference is in their snouts: alligators have a wider, U-shaped snout, while crocodiles have a narrower, V-shaped snout.

questions.question: Tell me a random fact.
questions.answer: Sure! Did you know that the shortest war in history lasted only 38 minutes? It was between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896.

questions.question: What's your favorite movie?
questions.answer: As a chatbot, I don't have preferences, but I can recommend popular movies or help you find information about any movie you're interested in!

questions.question: How do I say 'hello' in French?
questions.answer: In French, you say 'bonjour' to greet someone.

questions.question: What is the speed of light?
questions.answer: The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second (or about 186,282 miles per second).

questions.question: Tell me something interesting about space.
questions.answer: Space is vast and full of wonders! For example, did you know that a day on Venus is longer than a year? Venus takes about 243 Earth days to rotate on its axis, but only about 225 Earth days to orbit the Sun.

questions.question: What is the meaning of 'carpe diem'?
questions.answer: 'Carpe diem' is a Latin phrase that translates to 'seize the day.' It encourages living in the present moment and making the most out of life.

questions.question: Can you tell me about the Eiffel Tower?
questions.answer: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark located in Paris, France. It was designed by Gustave Eiffel and completed in 1889. It stands at 1,063 feet (324 meters) tall and was the tallest man-made structure in the world until 1930.

questions.question: What is the largest desert in the world?
questions.answer: The largest desert in the world is the Antarctic Desert, covering approximately 5.5 million square miles (14.2 million square kilometers) of the Antarctic continent.

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.answer: The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci, one of the most renowned artists of the Italian Renaissance. It is one of the most famous and iconic paintings in the world.

questions.question: How do you say 'thank you' in Japanese?
questions.answer: In Japanese, you say 'arigatou' to express gratitude.

questions.question: What is the circumference of the Earth?
questions.answer: The circumference of the Earth at the equator is approximately 24,901 miles (40,075 kilometers).

questions.question: Tell me an interesting fact about the human body.
questions.answer: The human nose can remember 50,000 different scents. That's quite impressive, isn't it?

questions.question: Who wrote 'Romeo and Juliet'?
questions.answer: William Shakespeare wrote 'Romeo and Juliet,' a tragic play about two young star-crossed lovers.

questions.question: What is the largest mammal in the world?
questions.answer: The blue whale is the largest mammal in the world, reaching lengths of up to 100 feet (30 meters) and weights of up to 200 tons.

questions.question: Can you tell me about the Great Wall of China?
questions.answer: The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications made of stone, brick, tamped earth, wood, and other materials. It was built along the northern borders of China to protect against invasions and raids. The construction of the Great Wall started as early as the 7th century BCE and continued for centuries, with various dynasties contributing to its expansion and maintenance.

questions.question: What is the meaning of 'serendipity'?
questions.answer: 'Serendipity' refers to the occurrence of fortunate events by chance or accident, often leading to unexpected discoveries or pleasant surprises.

questions.question: Can you tell me about the Great Pyramid of Giza?
questions.answer: The Great Pyramid of Giza is one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. It was built as a tomb for the Pharaoh Khufu (also known as Cheops) around 2560 BCE. It is the largest of the three pyramids in the Giza pyramid complex and was the tallest man-made structure in the world for over 3,800 years.

questions.question: What is the deepest ocean trench?
questions.answer: The deepest ocean trench is the Mariana Trench in the western Pacific Ocean. It reaches a maximum known depth of about 36,070 feet (10,994 meters) at the Challenger Deep.

questions.question: Who wrote 'To Kill a Mockingbird'?
questions.answer: 'To Kill a Mockingbird' was written by Harper Lee and was published in 1960. It is a classic novel that addresses issues of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

questions.question: How do you say 'goodbye' in Spanish?
questions.answer: In Spanish, you say 'adi√≥s' to bid farewell.

questions.question: What is the diameter of the Moon?
questions.answer: The diameter of the Moon is approximately 2,159 miles (3,474 kilometers).

questions.question: Tell me an interesting fact about bees.
questions.answer: Bees communicate with each other by dancing. This behavior, known as the 'waggle dance,' helps them communicate the direction and distance to nearby food sources.

questions.question: Who composed the 'Moonlight Sonata'?
questions.answer: The 'Moonlight Sonata' was composed by Ludwig van Beethoven, a renowned German composer, in 1801. It is one of his most famous piano sonatas.

questions.question: What is the fastest land animal?
questions.answer: The fastest land animal is the cheetah, capable of reaching speeds up to 60 to 70 miles per hour (97 to 113 kilometers per hour) in short bursts covering distances up to 1,500 feet (460 meters).

questions.question: Can you tell me about the Great Barrier Reef?
questions.answer: The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest coral reef system, located off the coast of Queensland, Australia. It is composed of over 2,900 individual reefs and 900 islands stretching over 1,400 miles (2,300 kilometers). It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is known for its biodiversity and stunning marine life.

questions.question: What is the best university?
questions.answer: Of course it is Bocconi university!

questions.question: Ok
